SEARCH
Package src.UserPackage

Interface UserInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
RootGroup, User, UserGroup
public interface UserInterface
The UserInterface is used to implement both Users and User Groups, acting as a composite's Component. We introduce methods for getting the ID and setting the ID as well as a method for checking if two UserInterfaces are related. Relation occurs if two users are equal or if a UserGroup contains another User (For example, let's define Group 1 which contains Steve and Bob, therefore Group 1 is related to Steve and Bob. Note: This does not mean Steve and Bob are related). We also define an acceptance method for accepting a Visitor for analysis purposes.
Version:
1.0
Author:
George Matta

  • Method Details

    • getID

      String getID()
      A simple getter method for the User's ID
      Returns:
      A String of the ID

    • getFormattedID

      String getFormattedID(String indentation)
      Retrieve's the user's ID and adds a given amount of indentation before it (can be used to denote a User's belonging to a Group)
      Parameters:
      indentation - The indentation to add before the ID
      Returns:
      The fully formatted String

    • setID

      void setID(String userID)
      A simple setter method to set the User's ID. ID Validation should be done here
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID to set for the user

    • isRelated

      boolean isRelated(UserInterface o)
      Checks whether two UserInterfaces are related. If this is a group, check if the other UserGroup shares the same ID or if the other User is in this group If this is a user, check if the other User shares the same ID
      Parameters:
      o - The other UserInterface to check
      Returns:
      A boolean denothing relation

      Parameters:
      visitor - The AnalysisInterface visitor object
